item.title: iptables: Allow Specific IP to Connect via SSH.
item.description: 1iptables -A INPUT -p tcp -s 114.191.33.88 --dport 22 -m conntrack --ctstate NEW,ESTABLISHED -j ACCEPT 2iptables -A OUTPUT -p tcp --sport 22 -m conntrack --ctstate ESTABLISHED -j ACCEPT

item.title: Specific IP Connection to SSH Using Firewalld Rich Rules
item.description: 1sudo firewall-cmd --add-rich-rule 'rule family="ipv4" source address="192.168.10.9" service name="ssh" accept' --permanent 2sudo firewall-cmd --remove-service ssh --permanent ## needed, otherwise ssh will still be allowed for all 3sudo systemctl reload firewalld See details in https://access.redhat.com/discussions/1342573
